conclusion: Problem involves a ball sliding on a track with an electric field affecting motion.
Objective is to find the release height h_a for the ball to fly out from point D.
PA is an inclined rail with angle θ = 53°.
AB is a horizontal rail.
BCD is a semicircular track with radius R = 0.5 m.
Electric field E = 6 × 10^6 V/m is present to the right of BD, directed horizontally to the left.
Ball a has mass m = 8 g = 0.008 kg.
Gravity is g = 10 m/s².
Ball is released from rest at height h_a on PA and slides freely.
Ball needs to fly out from point D with velocity such that no normal force acts on it.
Ball is insulating, so electric field affects motion only after leaving the track.
Track energy and motion of the ball from release point to point D.
Find relationship between height h_a and velocity at point D.
B, O, D lie on the same vertical line.
O is the center of the semicircle, B is at the bottom, D at the top.
Set up a coordinate system with point A at the origin (0,0).
Point P on PA at height h_a has coordinates: x = h_a * 0.75, y = h_a.
Find connection point A relative to O or B.
Find velocity of the ball at point A using energy conversion.
Potential energy at P is mgh_a, converted to kinetic energy at A.
Distance along PA is s = h_a / 0.8.
Horizontal distance from P to A is h_a * 0.75.
From A to B, rail is horizontal, so no change in gravitational potential energy.
